Adult_Dosing.text:
Dosing is
NOT
interchangeable between different formulations of amphotericin B due to significant variations in pharmacokinetics. Call your institution's pharmacy (or ID) if unsure about correct dose.

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: B
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out

Serious.text:
Nephrotoxicity/renal failure, hemorrhagic cystitis
Anaphylaxis
Cardiac arrest

Common.text:
Hypokalemia, hypomagnesemia, hyperglycemia (check BMP at least daily)
Rigors
Nausea/vomiting, diarrhea
Anemia
Rash
Dyspnea
Insomnia

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: Depends on formulation, 1-14 days
Metabolism: unknown
Excretion: urine

Comments.text:
Amphotericin B is an antifungal agent used to treat severe or disseminated fungal infections (e.g. invasive aspergillosis,
cryptoccoccal meningitis
,
coccidioidomycosis
,
mucormycosis
, fungemia in neutropenic patients). It comes in several formulations; conventional, cholesteryl sulfate complex, lipid complex, and liposomal. It is usually reserved for serious infection due to significant associated toxicities, though the newer formulations tend to be better tolerated.
